website_summaries.verdict: It's a solid bike with style boys like, but we recommend the Hot Wheels bike for kids that are still learning to ride.
pros: A combination of two classic bike styles
Sports moto-inspired handlebars and fender and rugged BMX tires
Has hand and coaster brakes and durable steel frame
cons: Our testers noted that the handlebars are not adjustable, and riding it is a bit difficult for novice riders to master

customer_reviews.title: This bike was surprisingly good for the cost
customer_reviews.text: This bike was surprisingly good for the cost! I bought it to donate at Christmas time, not for my own kid, but I assembled it and test-rode it myself and was impressed. I'm a total bike-snob, used to high-end rides, and while this isn't a premium product, it's very solidly made. They spent the money where it matters. If it can handle my old fat butt jumping it off my porch, it should stand up to a couple years of abuse by a kid. It also looks great. Your kid will dig it.
customer_reviews.author: Grim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and well made.
customer_reviews.text: I've been cycling for 50 years ad wish bikes were made this well when I was a kid. My son is now 7 years old, 48" tall, and about 50#. He is just big enough to ride it. This style seems better suited for young riders than bmx style.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. I wish handlebar rize was higher, think of bying another handlebar. Required some skills in order to tune everything before ride. Especially rear hand brake, because the wheel was not straight enough. In any case this bike is much better than anything you can by in Walmart ;)
customer_reviews.author: Serge

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking bike...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this bike. Comes mostly assembled. The build is better than you'd expect for the price. The whole bike is fairly heavy for a 7 year old but that's expected for a bike in this price range. Overall no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that you cannot raise the handlebars
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that you cannot raise the handlebars. Bought this bike for my five year old grandson. Turns out to be a difficult bike to learn on because seat & handlebars are at the same height. Would not have bought this bike for a beginning rider if I had realized the handle bar issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Feeley

customer_reviews.title: The bike is beautiful. As previously stated
customer_reviews.text: The bike is beautiful. As previously stated, the assembly instructions were confusing. The hand breaks are a little touchy. Good thing I used to take apart and put together my bikes 60 years ago. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Curly

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it. 7 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price for a decent 20” bike. My 7 year old grandson loves it! Easy to assemble. 15 minutes maybe, all parts and tools included.
customer_reviews.author: I spend too much here.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it, its faster than all his friends bikes
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would be a great bike, quality is there but the geometry is ...
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be a great bike, quality is there but the geometry is odd. It is a long stretch to the bars and you can't raise the bar height so the rider is really bent over.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality control needs work
customer_reviews.text: Product seems great, but ours arrived with a large dent on the front fork. Did not enjoy presenting our son with a dented bike on his birthday. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a very sharp looking bike and very comfortable ride.
customer_reviews.text: Grandson is 8 years old and loves this bike. It is a very sharp looking bike and very comfortable ride.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Ritter

customer_reviews.title: My son loved the bike
customer_reviews.text: My son loved the bike. Its a little tall for him but it will last him a long time. He is 7 years old. He was so excited to get it for Christmas. Its very nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: The pedal brake provides so much resistance that my son ...
customer_reviews.text: The pedal brake provides so much resistance that my son can hardly ride the bike. The moment you stop pedaling the bike stops itself. Also the handle brake did not work and I had to take it to a local bike shop and pay $20 to get that resolved. Currently trying to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Case

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bike is great but it is missing a bolt for the stem. Please contact me to resolve.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin N Mazzarese

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Adjustments
customer_reviews.text: The bike is quality enough. The major issue is that the handlebars do not have a height adjustment. You can raise and lower the saddle, but not the handlebars. My grandson really likes it though.
customer_reviews.author: LP9009

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's really cute but bummed it came to me dented !
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great bike - cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: The bike itself is great, however the chain guard literally broke to pieces during the 3rd or 4th ride. My son, who was riding at the time, hit his foot against it while getting momentum and then crack, pieces everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: E. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This bicycle 🚲 is good for an 8 year old child...
customer_reviews.author: Khalid Nazeri

customer_reviews.title: Addictive for Grandchildren!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 2 of my grandchildren, boys ages 6 and 7. I think they are addicted! Make sure you purchase a helmet along with the bicycle - safety first!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Calfee

customer_reviews.title: The fender broke on this bike within 10 days of receiving it! Very upset about that!
customer_reviews.text: The fender broke on this bike within 10 days of receiving it! Very upset about that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Question quality...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the bike looks very nice and provides a comfortable ride for my 6 year old grandson. However, having only had the bike for 2 months and having only ridden it perhaps 10 times, we were extremely disappointed when the cable on the handbrake broke. Fortunately the bike has coaster brakes as well, but still this is not a very comforting statement in regard to quality. We will try to contact the manufacturer to see if they will offer a repair solution, so I will followup with an amended review based on their response.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and it was missing several pieces and was clearly damaged. Very disappointing. Wish the handle bars were adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Beadielove

product_meta.title: Diamondback Bicycles Jr Venom Bike, 20" Wheels, Gloss Silver
product_meta.description: What happens when you mix a BMX bike with a moto-the Jr venom may just be the coolest kids bike we've ever made. With Mott bars, a fender to catch roosts, and big knobby tires, it's ready for the backyard race track. It has both a coaster brake and a hand brake to help the transition to bigger bikes in the future. Made of durable steel tubing wrapped in an aggressive graphics package, the Jr venom is the bike for little rippers.
feature_bullets: Heavy duty steel frame and fork
Rush alloy linear-pull brakes & coaster brakes give two options in stopping
